metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Steward, Officers and other Members of the St. Andrews Society, assembled at their Anniversary Meeting at Charlestown

The Humble Petition of Robert Scott of Charlestown

Sheweth

That your Petitioner is a native of Scotland and aged upwards of Sixty years, Twenty Seven years of which he has been a Resident in this Province and her paid his Share of all Taxes according to Law, That for the Space of Two or three years last past he has been disabled by the Rheumatism, by which his Limbs are rendered entirely useless, to Earn his Bread. And is now become Entirely helpless That your Petitioner is now reduced to the Extreme State of Poverty and yet is Unwilling to become burthensome [burdensome] to this Parish and if profitable no other Person.

Therefore humbly prays the worthy members to take his Unhappy Case under their Service and Consideration And Grant him Such Relief as they Shall think proper And as in Duty bound your Petitioner shall ever pray etc.

ChasTown 30th Novb 1786

Robert Scott
